So said  tumb@...  on  2003-02-18 --------------------

>Is there any recommended (or better yet documented) ideal level of
>testing? 
>Our company is working on adopting XP and perhaps test driven
practises.
>We have a question about whether certain groups are testing too little
or
>too much. How, if at all, do you determine what's too little or too
much?

Would more testing improve quality? If yes, then you may not be testing
enough; if not, then you are either testing just enough or too much.

Would less testing decrease quality? (You get the idea.)

There is no way to recommend a level of testing without knowing details
about the organization, the industry, the sector, the software...
that's what consultants are for.

Good luck.


J. B. Rainsberger,
